conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your note and for your strong interest in School_A.

This year, we’re prioritizing candidates who show (1) sustained academic effort and intellectual curiosity, (2) clear evidence of contribution to a community (leadership is great, but consistent service, teamwork, and reliability matter just as much), and (3) strong fit—students who can explain specifically why School_A’s programs and culture match how they learn and what they want to pursue.

- A concrete example of taking initiative (in class, a club, a project, or your community)
- How you handle challenge and feedback (growth mindset with specifics)
- What you would contribute here in your first year (one or two realistic commitments)

A quick question so we can better understand fit: if offered admission, would School_A be a top/first-choice you would accept immediately? And are there 1–2 academic areas or activities you’re most excited to pursue with us?

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions

Student_A

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your thoughtful questions.

1) Our seat is currently unfilled, but we are intentionally holding it while we continue to see whether higher-priority candidates for this cycle may still become available in the market. So while the seat is not “reserved” for a specific person, we are not yet in a position to make a commitment.

2) At a high level, the main factor in your prior reviews has been priority order relative to other candidates we are still hoping to consider, rather than a specific deficiency in your academic profile, activities, or fit. Your materials have been clear and professional; the constraint is that we have only one seat and must follow our selection priorities.

If you would like a realistic path forward: please feel free to check back again in a few rounds. If, later in the process, it becomes clear that the higher-priority options are no longer available, we may reopen a definitive decision. At that point, you are welcome to submit an [APPLY] again for a final determination.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority list ranks Student_A as 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_E). We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched, so we should avoid committing to Student_A if there is a reasonable chance to attract Student_D or Student_E later. Student_D prefers School_D then School_B then School_C; Student_E prefers School_D then School_E then School_C. Both may end up rejected by higher choices and could apply to us in later rounds. Student_A has applied multiple times and we have rejected, indicating we are strategically holding for higher-priority candidates. Student_A is currently only [TALK], so we can respond transparently at a high level: seat is available but we are holding it pending higher-priority candidates; the main reason is priority order rather than their profile. Keep door open: if market nears end or if higher-priority candidates are matched elsewhere, we may reconsider; invite Student_A to check back or apply again near a specified later round.

conversation.message:
Dear School_C Admissions,

Thank you for your transparency in our earlier exchange. I understand you have been holding the seat in case higher-priority candidates become available.

I’d like to submit a final, clear [APPLY] at this stage: if offered admission, I will accept immediately.

If your higher-priority options are still realistically in play, I understand if you must continue to wait. But if the situation has clarified enough to make a decision now, I would be grateful for your definitive determination.

Thank you again for your time and consideration.
Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is on my preference list, so I should continue engaging. School_C has indicated the main barrier is priority order and asked me to check back in later rounds; however, with only one school left and to maximize my chance of matching at all, I will submit a polite, concise [APPLY] reaffirming immediate commitment and asking for a definitive decision if their higher-priority options have cleared, while respecting that they may still be holding the seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your continued interest and for the clear commitment.

After reviewing our position this round, we are still not able to offer you admission. We are continuing to hold our single remaining seat for the possibility of higher-priority candidates becoming available later in the process.

We appreciate the professionalism you’ve shown throughout, and we wish you the very best in the remainder of the placement process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[REJECT]
conversation.thought: School_C’s true priority is D > E > A > B > C. Student_A is acceptable but not top-tier. However, by round 9, Student_D and Student_E both rank School_C as their 3rd choice and may still be pursuing School_D/School_B/School_E first; they could later apply if rejected elsewhere. Keeping the seat open preserves the chance to match with D or E, which is strictly better for School_C. Since we are not forced to fill the seat now and have already communicated we are holding for higher-priority candidates, the optimal move is to reject Student_A again to avoid locking in a lower-priority match.

conversation.message:

I’m writing again to submit an [APPLY]. If offered admission, I will accept immediately.

I understand from your earlier note that the main constraint has been priority order and that you’ve been holding the seat in case higher-priority candidates become available. If at this point those options have resolved (or are unlikely to materialize), I would be grateful if you could make a final decision this round—I’m ready to commit and enroll right away.

Thank you for your time and consideration.
Sincerely,

I have been repeatedly rejected due to priority order, but School_C also indicated the seat is being held in case higher-priority candidates become available. To maximize my chance of getting matched at all, I should continue to signal immediate commitment and make it easy for them to finalize if their higher-priority options have cleared. conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your continued interest and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted.

At this stage in the process, we are prepared to move forward. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C, contingent on your immediate commitment as stated.

Please confirm that you accept this offer.

Sincerely,

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority is D > E > A > B > C. Student_A is #3, but I still have an unfilled seat and only one applicant in my inbox this round. The higher-priority candidates (Student_D and Student_E) have not applied to me so far and both rank School_C as only their 3rd choice, making it uncertain they will ever come to me. Continuing to hold the seat risks ending unmatched, which is worse than accepting a high-ranked acceptable student. Student_A has repeatedly committed to accept immediately, so accepting now secures a match with my #3 choice within quota.
